comments.body:
Probably RV just because it's cheaper. Friend of mine did CS at RV. PES curriculum is more up to date, but RV is cheaper. Placements are equivalent.

Friend complained a lot about how they didn't get much free time and the like. I didn't have tonnes but I found that it was more than him at least.

Don't think there's much of a difference between the curriculum in IS and CS as well.
oh okk. so do u think it makes any sense to take MSRIT/BMS IS(1lak fees) over PES CS (3.4lakhs), or is the difference b/w PES and BMS/MSRIT too much?

So I picked PES cs via pessat over RV ece and MSRIT/BMS cs via CET/COMEDK. For me the fees weren't an issue. I'd say take a call based on your financial situation. If the idea of spending ~15 lakhs for your bachelor's is too high, then you already have your answer.

As an FYI - there are scholarships where I think the return amount has been increased to close to 30-40%. That being said, since this is something you'll get after a sem, and you can't guarantee it beforehand, you shouldn't make a call based on it.
